TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit TaskConstraints extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Execution constraints to apply to a task.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the TaskConstraints class.

MemberSignature.Value: public TaskConstraints (Nullable<TimeSpan> maxWallClockTime = null, Nullable<TimeSpan> retentionTime = null, Nullable<int> maxTaskRetryCount = null);

.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(valuetype System.Nullable`1<valuetype System.TimeSpan> maxWallClockTime, valuetype System.Nullable`1<valuetype System.TimeSpan> retentionTime, valuetype System.Nullable`1<int32> maxTaskRetryCount) cil managed
Public Sub New (Optional maxWallClockTime As Nullable(Of TimeSpan) = null, Optional retentionTime As Nullable(Of TimeSpan) = null, Optional maxTaskRetryCount As Nullable(Of Integer) = null)

Docs.param: The maximum elapsed time that the task may run, measured from the time the task starts. If the task does not complete within the time limit, the Batch service terminates it.

The minimum time to retain the task directory on the compute node where it ran, from the time it completes execution. After this time, the Batch service may delete the task directory and all its contents.
The maximum number of times the task may be retried. The Batch service retries a task if its exit code is nonzero.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the TaskConstraints class.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Property MaxTaskRetryCount As Nullable(Of Integer)
member this.MaxTaskRetryCount : Nullable<int> with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of times the task may be retried. The Batch service retries a task if its exit code is nonzero.
Docs.remarks: Note that this value specifically controls the number of retries. The Batch service will try the task once, and may then retry up to this limit. For example, if the maximum retry count is 3, Batch tries the task up to 4 times (one initial try and 3 retries). If the maximum retry count is 0, the Batch service does not retry the task. If the maximum retry count is -1, the Batch service retries the task without limit.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Property MaxWallClockTime As Nullable(Of TimeSpan)
member this.MaxWallClockTime : Nullable<TimeSpan> with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the maximum elapsed time that the task may run, measured from the time the task starts. If the task does not complete within the time limit, the Batch service terminates it.
Docs.remarks: If this is not specified, there is no time limit on how long the task may run.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Property RetentionTime As Nullable(Of TimeSpan)
member this.RetentionTime : Nullable<TimeSpan> with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the minimum time to retain the task directory on the compute node where it ran, from the time it completes execution. After this time, the Batch service may delete the task directory and all its contents.
Docs.remarks: The default is infinite, i.e. the task directory will be retained until the compute node is removed or reimaged.
